data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3326987,"name":"","username":"MilkMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T18:16:36.656Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello, I am trying to do closed loop control on our \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCTRE\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Cross The Road Electronics\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e swerve due to one module running at a lower velocity than the others which causes unwanted rotation of the drivebase. I was wondering how I would tune the closed-loop control, would I start with a low kP and increase until oscillation and then run SYSID? Or would it be better to replace the drive motor of the module that has a slower velocity?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T18:16:36.656Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":43,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":239.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457744,"topic_slug":"closed-loop-control-ctre-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61308,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/closed-loop-control-ctre-swerve/457744/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3326989,"name":"amber","username":"amb","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e36b37/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T18:19:44.533Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eRun SysID first, then tune P until it tracks the way you want it to, although if it’s a motor problem it would be best to try to swap it\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T18:20:11.688Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457744,"topic_slug":"closed-loop-control-ctre-swerve","display_username":"amber","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54285,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"not programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327095,"name":"kylelanman","username":"kylelanman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kylelanman/{size}/3427_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T19:46:16.453Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe ran into a similar problem where 1 of our modules was running slower than the other modules.  We were using Krakens.  We ended up plotting supply voltage and discovered that the voltage was being pulled down lower on the motor when under load which points to a high resistance connection.  Sure enough the ring terminal for power on the Kraken was loose.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI’ll also add that we replaced the motor first.  Shortly after replacing the motor the symptoms moved to a different module.  It was at that point that it felt more like a software / electrical problem.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe first verified that our duty cycle was the same across motors and that we were getting a slower rotor velocity on that particular module.  It was only after that we thought to plot supply voltage to the motors.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T19:50:45.393Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":67.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457744,"topic_slug":"closed-loop-control-ctre-swerve","display_username":"kylelanman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9953,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/closed-loop-control-ctre-swerve/457744/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327638,"name":"","username":"MilkMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T06:40:11.391Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe also swapped out our drive motor recently but I haven’t been able to test it because we had to remove all of the electronics.
